article:
'DVB-T' is an abbreviation for "'Digital Video Broadcasting â Terrestrial'"; it
is the DVB European-based consortium standard for the broadcast transmission of
digital terrestrial television that was first published in 1997 and first broadcast in the UK in 1998. This system transmits compressed digital audio, digital
video and other data in an MPEG transport stream, using coded orthogonal frequency-
division multiplexing (COFDM or OFDM) modulation.
headings: Technical description of a DVB-T transmitter
